message.content: We have that $i^2 = -1$. Replacing $i$ with $-1$, we have the sum $(-1)^{-100} + (-1)^{-99} + \cdots + (-1)^{-1} + (-1)^0 + (-1)^1 + \cdots + (-1)^{99} + (-1)^{100}$. Note that $(-1)^k$ is equal to $-1$ when $k$ is odd and $1$ when $k$ is even. Since the vast majority of the terms in the sum are $-1$, we can simplify the sum to $1(100) + (-1)(100) = \boxed{0}$.
